circumstances.circumstancesOfRecovery: On 12/06/2012 the KCSO was notified of found human skeletal remains in the Fernan area. Near the remains a wallet was located which contained ID's for a Jessie Dean Stacy and Jesse Dean Hayes.

conditionOfRemains.name: Not recognizable - Partial skeletal parts only
conditionOfRemains.localizedName: Not recognizable - Partial skeletal parts only

clothingAndAccessoriesArticles.description: Large, black back pack, a coffee cup, hat, ski or hiking pole, holster pair of pants with wallet with 2 different Identification cards- Jessie Dean Hayes / Jesse Dean Stacy.  A .38 revolver weapon also recovered near remains, 50% rusted, loaded with 4 live rounds, 1 spent round.  Collapsible walking stick, water purifier, small emergency kit, a bible, cooking utensils and other personal items. They are located at KCSD evidence
Possible jeans

circumstances.description: In the Snake River below the falls in Idaho Falls
circumstances.circumstancesOfRecovery: On 4/3/2022, a father and son were fishing on the Snake River below the falls in Idaho Falls, on the west side of the river by the Quality Inn on River Parkway. While they were fishing, they reeled in a bone that looked like part of a skull.

circumstances.circumstancesOfRecovery: The body of the victim was found on a walking trail up Jacobs Gulch. He had died of an apparent self-inflicted gunshot wound to the right side of his head. The gun, recovered from beneath the body, was a 9mm semiautomatic Smith & Wesson Model 915. He was well dressed, well nourished and did not appear to be a transient type person.

conditionOfRemains.name: Recognizable face
conditionOfRemains.localizedName: Recognizable face

Grey, blue and black, long sleeve button up shirt; black Wrangler jeans with a black leather weave belt. Black nylon shoulder holster with empty double magazine pouch.
Black "Members Only" jacket, size Medium

glasses:  right RX stronger than left-unique no line bifocals-

silver colored belt buckle with turquoise stone

circumstances.circumstancesOfRecovery: Skeletal remains were discovered in a wooded area near Highway 53 and Greensferry Road near the paintball field in Rathdrum.  The decedent is believed to be a male in his late 20s to 30s, approximately 6’2” tall, with short brown hair.  Estimates place the time of death around late summer to fall/early winter of 2021.

Blue colored flannel button up shirt and a Canyon Guide Outfitters brand denim jacket
Ankle length AND 1 brand socks and blue/gray Sketcher brand shoes
No jewelry or watch was noted on or near the body

circumstances.circumstancesOfRecovery: On June 26, 1982, the body of an unidentified male was recovered from the Idaho side of the Snake River near the mouth of the Grand Ronde River in Nez Perce County, Idaho, approximately 25 miles south of Lewiston. Based on the condition of the remains, the decedent had likely been deceased for 2-3 weeks prior to discovery.

circumstances.circumstancesOfRecovery: Died at Sacred Heart Catholic Church in Boise, Idaho.  Toxicology tests found cyanide in the man’s blood.  The body was located with a suicide note and instructions to be cremated, signed in the name of “Wm. L. Toomey” but no other identification was located.  All leads to connect the name to the deceased turned up negative.

documents.caption: Artist rendering with associated news articles

circumstances.circumstancesOfRecovery:
The decedent was homeless, living in local hotels or in the woods, and known in the Boise, Idaho area since 2019 as Christopher Robbin Croswell or as Daryl Taylor.  It appears the name Daryl Taylor was assumed by the decedent in 1995 and Christopher Croswell was assumed in 2012.

It was reported that he lived in western Oregon prior to coming to Boise and that he spent time in Florida, Texas, and Oregon before eventually arriving in Idaho.

His age is undetermined but was reported as 53 years.  Unable to establish his date of birth but possible years of birth are 1962 and 1968.  His true identity was unknown at the time of his death.

conditionOfRemains.name: Recognizable face
conditionOfRemains.localizedName: Recognizable face
